page.title: 14Yealmpton Agricultural Show
page.content: {The Yealmpton Show}is an agricultural event which has been held more or less annually since 1874. By 1886 the show had 24 classes.By 1985 it has grown to 130 livestock & gymkhana classes, 35 produce classes,106 horticultural classes with entries of over 2000. The show grounds are owned by the Bastard family of Kitley Estate. The turnover of the show has grown to {Â£13,000 per annum}and from the profit, donations are given to charity. The committee of the association number 120, all of whom are involved on a voluntary basis. the number {attending}the show is now about {10,000.} This year,{1985 was the 99th show.}The main ring attractions this year included a falconry and sheepdog display.There is also always a full range of trade stands.
